standard_metadata.standard_description: Add and subtract mixed numbers with like denominators, e.g., by replacing each mixed number with an equivalent fraction, and/or by using properties of operations and the relationship between addition and subtraction.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Add and subtract mixed numbers (no regrouping)

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD9 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{12}} + \blueD6 \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{12}}$
$9{\dfrac{1}{12}} + 6{\dfrac{7}{12}} = {15} {\dfrac{8}{12}}$  The answer can also be written as ${15}{\dfrac{2}{3}}$ .
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD7 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{12}} + \blueD4 \maroonD{\dfrac{9}{12}}$
${7 \dfrac{1}{12}} + {4 \dfrac{9}{12}} = {11 \dfrac{10}{12}}$  The answer can also be written as ${11\dfrac{5}{6}}$ .
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD8 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{6}} + \blueD4 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{6}}$
${8 \dfrac{2}{6}} + {4 \dfrac{1}{6}} = {12 \dfrac{3}{6}}$  The answer can also be written as ${12\dfrac{1}{2}}$ .
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD6 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{4}} + \blueD5 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{4}}$
${6 \dfrac{1}{4}} + {5 \dfrac{1}{4}} = {11 \dfrac{2}{4}}$  The answer can also be written as ${11\dfrac{1}{2}}$ .
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD3 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{5}} + \blueD6 \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{5}}$
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD4 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{5}} + \blueD8 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{5}}$
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD5 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{3}} + \blueD3 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{3}}$
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD7 \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{10}} + \blueD7 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{10}}$
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD9 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{6}} + \blueD2 \maroonD{\dfrac{4}{6}}$
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD4 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{5}} + \blueD1 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{5}}$
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD6 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{4}} + \blueD2 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{4}}$
${8\dfrac{2}{4}}={6\dfrac{1}{4}} + {2\dfrac{1}{4}} $  The answer can also be written as ${8\dfrac{1}{2}}$ .
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD4 \maroonD{\dfrac{5}{12}} + \blueD3 \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{12}}$
$ {7\dfrac{8}{12}}={4 \dfrac{5}{12}} + {3\dfrac{3}{12}}$  The answer can also be written as ${7\dfrac{2}{3}}$ .
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD9 \maroonD{\dfrac{11}{12}} - \blueD2\maroonD{\dfrac{8}{12}}$
$9{\dfrac{11}{12}} - 2{\dfrac{8}{12}} = {7} {\dfrac{3}{12}}$  The answer can also be written as ${7}{\dfrac{1}{4}}$ .
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD2 \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{10}} - \blueD1\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{10}}$
${2 \dfrac{7}{10}} - {1\dfrac{2}{10}} = {1\dfrac{5}{10}}$  The answer can also be written as ${1\dfrac{1}{2}}$ .
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD8 \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{6}} - \blueD2\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{6}}$
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD7 \maroonD{\dfrac{11}{12}} - \blueD1\maroonD{\dfrac{6}{12}}$
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD8 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{3}} - \blueD1\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{3}}$
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD7 \maroonD{\dfrac{4}{12}} - \blueD1\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{12}}$
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD4 \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{5}} - \blueD3\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{5}}$
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD7 \maroonD{\dfrac{9}{10}} - \blueD5\maroonD{\dfrac{6}{10}}$
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD9 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{8}} - \blueD6\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{8}}$
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD5 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{5}} - \blueD1\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{5}}$
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD3 \maroonD{\dfrac{5}{6}} - \blueD1\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{6}}$
$ {2\dfrac{2}{6}}={3\dfrac{5}{6}} - {1\dfrac{3}{6}} $  The answer can also be written as ${2\dfrac{1}{3}}$ .
Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD7 \maroonD{\dfrac{6}{10}} - \blueD4\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{10}}$
